title: Youth worker 'forced child sex abuse victims she met at care home into sex work'
text:
Samaria Williams (pictured) and Kendra Bey are charged with trafficking girls Bey met at Milwaukee Academy (Picture: WISN/Wisconsin Department of Justice)

Two teenage girls were forced into prostitution by a youth worker they met at a mental health treatment facility for sex abuse victims, according the Wisconsin Department of Justice.

Samaria Williams, 23, and Kendra Bey, 27, were both charged with trafficking a child on Tuesday in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.

Bey reportedly groomed the two teenage victims in 2015 while working at the Milwaukee Academy. It treats girls who show a ‘pattern of behavioral and mental health symptoms’ or have been ‘impacting by sex trafficking and exploitation,’ according to their website.

The girls reconnected with Bey and Williams after they left the facility and ran away from their foster homes.

Bey and Williams began driving the girls to Chicago to be trafficked, police say. The older victim said she was still 15-years-old at the time, according to the Journal Sentinel.

Investigators said Bey and Williams set up ‘dates’ for the two girls where they would perform sex acts with strangers for money. Afterwards, they gave all of the money they made to Bey.

The older girl said she worked for Williams and Bey until she was 17, adding that she was tired of giving Williams and Bey all her money, but she knew she would get beaten up of she kept them money, authorities said.

She said that the first time she had sexual intercourse with ‘customers’ was at William’s condominium.

Bey and Williams began scamming men at the condo, the girl said. The pair would tell the customer to go buy a condom, then would either go to a different apartment or not let the men back in when they returned.

The older victim eventually moved in with Williams after she and Bey stopped being friends. While living with Williams, the teen was required to make $500 per day, which usually meant three or four ‘dates,’ police said.

She said both Williams and Bey beat her. During one violent incident in April 2017, Bey and Williams allegedly forced the older girl to strip naked then locked her in a bedroom all night.

Bey later reached out to the two girls and invited them to live with her. She and another would took the girls to Iowa to have sex for money, according to complaint.

The younger victim said she had about ten ‘dates’ and the teens were sometimes advertised as a ‘two girl special,’ which cost about $400 to $500, investigators wrote.

Bey and the other woman told the girls they would get half the money, but allegedly kept it all.

According to the Wisconsin Department of Justice, the alleged crimes occurred from about August 2014 to May 2017.

If convicted of all charges, Bey could be sentenced to more than 90 years in prison. Williams faces 50 years if convicted of all charges.
description: Samaria Williams, 23, and Kendra Bey, 27, were both charged with trafficking girls on Tuesday in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
